sub_title: Researcher in Quantitative Studies of Science; Social media studies of Science; Social Media Metrics (Altmetrics), Scientometrics analysis; Research Evaluation.
summary:
My expertise is in Quantitative Studies of Science specializing in Social Media Metrics (Altmetrics), Scientometrics analysis, & Research Evaluation. I'm also interested in Open Science and Open Access to research outputs, open research data and infrastructure, and public interest in science.

I've diverse scientific, executive, professional, and advisory experiences gained from my career path and different roles (as a university lecturer, head of department, researcher, project advisor, scientific and editorial board member) that I've performed. 

I'm highly motivated and very enthusiastic to learn new things and gain diverse experiences in my area of expertise and beyond. I've great perseverance in achieving my scientific and professional goals. I'm  a great team player and feel highly responsible to perform the tasks that I'm responsible for. I enjoy my advisory role in helping others to grow by sharing my knowledge and experiences with them and leading and supervising their works to achieve success. I enjoy solving problems and different challenges. 

Biking, swimming, and cooking are my favorite hobbies.

education.field_of_study: Quantitative Studies of Science specializing in Social media metrics and research evaluation

awards.title: 4th SCImago-EPI Award for the best article published in the 2014-2018 period (Information Section) in The information professional journal.
TNA SoBigData project grant, Natural language processing group, department of Computer science, University of Sheffield, April 2018.
Honorable mention of the Eugene Garfield Doctoral Dissertation Scholarship Award
awards.description:
Dear Zohreh,

the ISSI committee wrote: 
 
The research proposal of Zohreh Zahedi is a relevant contribution to the field with high innovative potential. Altmetric indicators are gaining in popularity, but little concrete is known about their advantages and disadvantages. The proposal has a strong and focused research plan, and will contribute to knowledge by investigating the features and potentials of several central altmetric sources and metrics, the motivations of scholars for using these and will develop a theoretical framework for their use in research evaluation.  
 
After an extensive review process of the submissions for the award the members of the committee: Birger Larsen, Kevin Boyack, Cinzia Daraio and Jacqeline Leta decided to grant Zohreh Zahedi an 'honorable mention'​ for her submission "possibilities and feasibility of using 'altmetric'​ measurements (social media metrics) in research evaluation. this honorable mention should be considered as a way of recognition and encouragement for her work. We are looking forward to read the results of her work, expecting it to be of real value to the community.

For this reason you receive an "honorable mention"​.
 

See you in Istanbul,
 
Ronald Rousseau 
President ISSI; new web page: http://www.issi-society.org/

http://users.telenet.be/ronald.rousseau/html/garfield_scholarship.html

We have been awarded the funding by Thomson Reuters for our altmetrics research project which will examine and compare the differences and consistency of altmetrics data across the different commercial and non-commercial providers.

SIG/MET is the Association for Information Science & Technology (ASIS&T) Special Interest Group for the measurement of information production and use:

https://www.asist.org/SIG/SIGMET/about-sigmet/officers/
https://www.asist.org/groups/metrics-met/
profile_positions.title: Treasurer Officer at SIG/MET, Association for Information Science & Technology

profile_positions.description: LEO is a platform for PhD candidates at Leiden University. We organize social events, scientific lectures and workshops, represent PhD-specific interests, and maintain contact with other PhD organizations in the Netherlands. LEO activities are a great opportunity to meet PhD students from other departments. In addition, LEO can influence decision making at the University through its presence in the University Council and through meetings held regularly with the Vice Rector Magnificus. By working together with the PhD candidates Network of the Netherlands (PNN) we even have a nationwide influence, for example through contacts with the Association of Dutch Universities and the Ministry of Education.
profile_positions.title: Leiden Univeristy PhD Association (LEO) Board Member

profile_positions.description: I won the Leiden University Fund proposal grant for doing a collaborative altmetrics research with École de bibliothéconomie et des sciences de l'information(EBSI),Université de Montréal(UDeM) Canada.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Researcher
